title: NPP wins Ampara UC, Bope Poddala Pradeshiya Sabha
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has won the Ampara Urban Council and Bope Poddala Pradeshiya Sabha with majority.

title: NPP claims control of Ja-Ela UC and Chilaw PS
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has secured significant victories in local authorities across Sri Lanka. The party claimed control of the Ja-Ela Urban Council in the Gampaha District and the Chilaw Pradeshiya Sabha in the Puttalam District, strengthening its foothold in these key regions.

title: NPP secures key local bodies in Gampaha district
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has claimed control of three major local authorities in the Gampaha District. The party secured victories in the Kelaniya Pradeshiya Sabha, the Wattala Pradeshiya Sabha, and the Peliyagoda Urban Council, further strengthening its presence in the area.

title: Opposition parties collectively outperform NPP in several areas
byline: The opposition parties have managed to outnumber the ruling National People’s Power (NPP) in a number of local authorities.

title: SJB takes Kalpitiya PS, NPP wins two, ITAK claims Koralaipattu
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has claimed the Kalpitiya Pradeshiya Sabha in the Puttalam District, while the National People’s Power (NPP) secured both the Puttalam Municipal Council in the same district and the Hanguranketha Pradeshiya Sabha in the Nuwara Eliya District, and Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) claimed the Koralaipattu Pradeshiya Sabha.

title: NPP secure Puttalam, Nawagaththegama, Anamaduwa Sabhas
byline: The National People’s Power has secured victories in the Puttalam, Nawagaththegama, and Anamaduwa Pradeshiya Sabhas within the Puttalam District.

title: Sri Lanka’s democracy has developed so much that only a few have turned out to vote: RW
byline: Sri Lanka’s democracy has developed and has become just like what you see in the countries such as UK as only a few have turned up to vote in the local government elections compared to elections in the recent past, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe said today.

title: SJB wins Akurana PS; National Congress takes Akkaraipattu MC
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) secured control of the Akurana Pradeshiya Sabha with 14,638 votes and 13 seats.

title: US and China to start talks over trade war this week
byline: US and Chinese officials are set to start talks this week to try to deescalate a trade war between the world’s two biggest economies.

title: Asian airlines re-route, cancel flights due to India-Pakistan fighting
byline: Several Asian airlines said on Wednesday they were re-routing or cancelling flights to and from Europe because of fighting between India and Pakistan.

title: ITAK makes comeback in North, Muslim parties in East
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP), which ate into the heartlands of the traditional Tamil and Muslim parties in the North and the East, has suffered a setback this time.

title: FLSP vote share doubles
byline: The Frontline Socialist Party (FLSP) has been able to almost double its share of vote base at the Local Government elections compared to its past performances, according to the party’s Education Secretary Pubudu Jayagoda.

title: NPP leads LG polls with 43% vote share
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) is leading decisively in the Local Government elections with 43.44% of the votes and with 3,412,883 votes counted so far.

title: Sajith comes out with picture of chessboard in his FB page
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa has come up with a picture of a chess board in his Facebook account, indicating that there could be discussions or that dealings will be on the cards to form administrations of local bodies.

title: NPP gains ground across Kegalle and Anuradhapura
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has recorded victories in multiple local government bodies, solidifying its political presence in both the Kegalle and Anuradhapura districts.

title: ITAK, ACTC secure key local government victories in Jaffna district
byline: The Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) has claimed significant victories in the recently concluded local government elections in the Jaffna District, securing control of the Chavakachcheri, Nallur, and Walikamam-West Pradeshiya Sabhas.

title: Several Indian planes shot down and soldiers taken prisoner, Pakistan officials say
byline: Several Indian planes have been shot down, and some soldiers have been taken prisoner, Pakistan officials have said, after India claimed it attacked nine militant hideouts in Pakistan.

title: Discussions begin to form administrations in local bodies: SJB
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has already begun discussions with other parties to form administrations in local bodies where the ruling National People’s Power (NPP) has become a minority, SJB General Secretary Ranjith Madduma Bandara said.

title: SLPP regains lost vote share
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), which was reduced to rubble at the last General Elections with just three per cent of votes, has made some gains at this Local Government elections.

title: NPP faces challenges in capturing CMC
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has been unable to secure an absolute majority at the Colombo Municipal Council, the largest municipality of Sri Lanka, according to a post on X by Opposition MP Mujibur Rahman.

title: Opposition parties collectively outperform NPP in many areas
byline: The Opposition parties have been able to outnumber the ruling National People’s Power (NPP) in a number of local authorities.

title: India strikes Pakistan in aftermath of Kashmir tourist killings
byline: India attacked nine sites in Pakistan and Pakistani Kashmir on Wednesday with at least three deaths reported, and Pakistan said it was mounting a response as the worst fighting in years erupted between the longstanding enemies.

title: Writ petition against Minister Ananda Wijepala dismissed
byline: The writ petition filed challenging Minister Ananda Wijepala’s eligibility to continue as a Member of Parliament was dismissed today by the Court of Appeal.

title: Cardinals gather in Vatican to elect new pope
byline: Cardinals will take part in a mass at St Peter’s Basilica this morning and will later walk to the Sistine Chapel to cast their votes under Michelangelo’s frescoes, News.Az reports, citing BBC.

title: Sajith willing to bow to people’s verdict, work with opposition parties
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today announced his willingness to respect the people’s verdict and expressed readiness to cooperate with the other opposition parties.

title: SJB says it will form new administration of CMC with other parties
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) will form the new administration in the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) together with other parties, while the new mayor will be from our party,’’ SJB General Secretary Ranjith Madduma Bandara told the media.

title: CMC Mayor to be elected through council vote as no clear majority
byline: The race for the next Mayor of Colombo remains wide open as no party has secured a clear majority in the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) following the latest Local Government elections.

title: Public should reject parties trying to postpone elections: IRES Director
byline: Executive Director of the Institute for Democratic Reforms and Electoral Studies (IRES), Manjula Gajanayake, today urged the public not to vote for any political leader or party attempting to postpone elections, adding that voters have sent a clear message in this regard.

title: NPP rules out joining opposition parties to form councils: Tilvin
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) will not join hands with opposition parties rejected by the people to establish councils, JVP General Secretary Tilvin Silva said today.

title: NPP fails to secure majority in Colombo Municipal Council
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has won the most number of seats in the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC), but has not obtained enough to form a majority.

title: NPP secures over 4.3 million votes, with less than 10 results pending
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has so far gained over 4,361,127 votes and secured 3,802 members in the 2025 Local Government elections, with the results of fewer than 10 divisions yet to be announced.

title: Prasanna Ranaweera surrenders
byline: Former State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera, who had been evading arrest, surrendered to the Mahara Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Independent Group wins Beruwala UC
byline: Independent Group 1 has recorded victory in the Beruwala Urban Council with 9,757 votes securing 7 seats.

title: SL human development progress slows as regional peers catch up
byline: Sri Lanka continues to stand tall in the high human development category. However, latest data by the United Nations shows that the momentum is slowing, with regional peers closing in fast.

title: NPP leads in 200 LG bodies, gains absolute majority in 99
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has won a majority of seats in 200 out of 258 local government bodies where results have been released so far.

title: Death of remandee while in Prison custody: BASL calls for impartial probe
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has called for an immediate, impartial and independent investigation into the tragic death of a suspect, who was remanded and later died while in prison custody.

title: Ranil to visit India tomorrow
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe will visit India tomorrow (May 8 2025) to attend a function organised by The Hindu newspaper in the State of Karnataka.

title: Keheliya arrested again
byline: Former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella has been arrested again by the Bribery Commission.

title: Buddhist leaders urge UK to halt auction of Buddha-linked relics
byline: The Supreme Patriarchs (Mahanayaka Theros) of four main Buddhist chapters - Malwatta, Asgiriya, Amarapura, and Ramanna - have appealed to the British government to intervene and stop the public auction of archaeological relics believed to be linked to the corporeal remains of Lord Buddha.

title: This is just the beginning, Namal on LG polls results
byline: In the wake of the just concluded Local Government (LG) elections, National Organiser of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), Namal Rajapaksa expressed renewed optimism about the party’s future, despite failing to secure control of any local councils.

title: Some parties in north seeking NPP support to form councils: Bimal
byline: Political parties in the North have reached out to the National People’s Power (NPP) to establish councils in the North as none of the political parties have secured absolute majority in any local body in the North, Minister Bimal Ratnayake said today.

title: Pakistan’s NSC condemns ’Operation Sindoor’, urges global response
byline: Following the launch of ’Operation Sindoor’ by the Indian Armed Forces—targeting terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir, the National Security Committee (NSC) of Pakistan has condemned the strikes and called on the international community to recognize the gravity of India’s ’’unprovoked and illegal actions’’.

title: Prasanna Ranaweera remanded
byline: Former State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera was remanded until May 19 by the Mahara Magistrate’s Court today after surrendering to authorities.

title: Operation Sindoor: Indian High Commission in Colombo issues statement
byline: The Indian High Commission in Colombo has issued a statement following the launch of ’Operation Sindoor’ by the Indian Armed Forces, targeting terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Mandate is not total votes of all rejected parties: Tilvin
byline: Claiming that the electoral system is faulty, JVP general secretary Tilvin Silva said today that the mandate is not the total votes of all the rejected parties but the majority votes secured by a single party.

title: Cardinals set to begin voting to elect new pope in Sistine Chapel
byline: Cardinals will take part in a mass at St Peter’s Basilica this morning and will later walk to the Sistine Chapel to cast their votes under Michelangelo’s frescoes, News.Az reports, citing BBC.

title: NPP sweeps 2025 LG elections with over 4.5 Mn votes
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has emerged as the clear winner in the 2025 Local Government Elections securing 4,503,930 votes (43.26%) and 3,927 seats across Sri Lanka.

title: Two killed in lorry-motorcycle crash
byline: Two persons were killed in a motorcycle-lorry crash at Guru Godella on the Weeraketiya-Ranna main road this evening.

title: Police can search anyone wearing full-face helmets, acting suspiciously
byline: Sri Lanka Police have announced that they have full authority to search anyone wearing full-face helmets and or behaving suspiciously.

title: SLPP controls 50% of Pradeshiya Sabha budget decisions: Kariyawasam
byline: Following the results of the Local Government elections, 50 percent of the Pradeshiya Sabha budget is required to be decided by the SLPP.

title: UNP ready for a dialogue with other Opposition parties: Thalatha
byline: The United National Party (UNP) is willing to engage in dialogue to determine ways and means to cooperate with other Opposition parties to form joint administrations in local bodies of which the Opposition enjoys a majority, party General Secretary Thalatha Athukorala said today.

title: Booze banned for three days for this Vesak: Excise Dept
byline: Countrywide liquor sales will be banned for three days for the upcoming Vesak festival as decided by the Cabinet of Ministers, the Department of Excise announced today.

title: CSE turns red, post Local Government Election
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) exhibited negative momentum throughout the trading session. The All-Share Price Index (ASPI) moved lower, closing below the 15,900 mark, following the local government election in Sri Lanka.

title: Suspect arrested over attempted abduction near girls’ school in Colombo
byline: The Cinnamon Gardens Police arrested a 36-year-old man in connection with an attempted abduction near a prominent girls’ school in Colombo, police said.

title: Keheliya Rambukwella remanded
byline: Former Minister of Mass Media, Health and Environment, Keheliya Rambukwella, was remanded till May 20 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali today, over allegations of misappropriating approximately Rs. 8 million in Ministry funds to pay salaries and maintain staff—despite these individuals not rendering any official services.
